attributes.action: Grammar schools in England, take exams in September or cancel but must not delay
attributes.additional_details: During pandemic all GCSE and A levels have been cancelled which are key to determine future of kids, while authorities are considering to delay secondary transfer test. This feels unfair for kids who have not been able to study since last three months due to closure of schools and tuition centers and disadvantaged kids. If this gets delayed then it will have huge impact on mental health of kids to continue to study for coming months. We strongly recommend to either take exams on time or cancel.
attributes.background: We would like all Grammar Schools in England to either continue with Secondary transfer test as original dates or cancel it completely. This would be unfair on all kids preparing for last two years specially while kids have lost their key education time in last three months, if exams get delayed.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
